text: Martin Richard Hoffmann (April 20, 1932 â€“ July 14, 2014) was an American politician. He served as the United States Secretary of the Army between 1975 and 1977. Martin was born in Stockbridge, Massachusetts on April 20, 1932. Hoffmann served as general counsel of the Department of Defense, 1974 - 75. He was appointed as Secretary of the Army from August 5, 1975 until February 13, 1977. He died of cancer in Warren, Virginia, aged 82. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Virginia Category:Politicians from Massachusetts Category:United States Secretaries of the Army Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
